alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of moderate to locally heavy snow showers will affect northwestern Kennebec... Oxford...Androscoggin...northwestern Cumberland...southeastern Franklin...southeastern Coos...east central Grafton and northeastern Carroll Counties... At 357 AM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Mexico Maine to near Woodstock NH...and moving east AT 20 MPH. Another area was on the west side of Sebago lake ME. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Conway, Farmington, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Naples, Rumford, Turner, Oakland, Gray, Jay, Belgrade, Livermore Falls, Dixfield, and Hiram. This includes the following highways... Interstate 93 between mile markers 92 and 102. Interstate 95 between mile markers 64 and 83. This also includes... Crawford Notch State Park, Mount Jefferson, Mount Eisenhower, Mount Chocorua, and Wildcat Mountain. * Visibilities will locally drop to less than a half mile in this area of snow showers. * Snowfall accumulation of a half inch to an inch is possible in spots early this morning. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
